Articles.Content: I am trying to create an unforlding rover with the wheels mounted on pistons... but the wheels will stay in place as the piston moves through them. Particularly I am using the 1p2 psiton and the rovomax S2 wheels.

3 hours ago, CattyNebulart said:

I am trying to create an unforlding rover with the wheels mounted on pistons... but the wheels will stay in place as the piston moves through them. Particularly I am using the 1p2 psiton and the rovomax S2 wheels.

Wheels, AFAIK, are always auto-strutted to root. So they will not move, no matter what.

Edited June 2, 2019 by Lisias
Mistake. See post below

Players expected this bug,  [Edit: but it seems that the motorized parts deal with auto-struts properly.  
The former problem with autostruts across the claw-pivot,  https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/18849, seems to have been partially fixed in version 1.7.1]

The inner cylinder of the piston doesn't seem to accept surface-attachment, only attachment by the green-ball 'nodes'.   Wheels usually surface-attach but when I try that on the piston they only stick to the outer cylinder.

So you can turn the piston upside down, so the outer cylinder is the one that moves,
or node-attach some other part at the bottom of each piston, and put the wheels on that other part.

Edited June 2, 2019 by OHara

If you need to use wheels with robotic parts, it is always good practice to put some other parts between wheel and robotic parts.
Stock wheels autostrut themself by default to heaviest part. But, if heaviest part is too far away, in terms of how many parts are between wheels and heaviest craft part, then wheels autostrut themself to grandparent part.

Knowing this, you can workaround of that issue. To be sure, enable autostrut visualisation trough ALT+F12 cheat menu. That can help a lot to figure out what is going on.

Another option is to not use stock wheels at all. Use wheels from Kerbal foundries, those will not autostrut by themselfs to anything until you deceide to do so. For stock wheels you have no option to disable autostruting. If you ask me that was very bad decision from very begining, to don't allow user to deceide, should wheels be or not autostruted anywhere. That was very hacky solution for wheel issue that still does not work well enough.
